item.title: Criteo predicts that half of all e-commerce in Asia will be conducted through mobile devices
item.description:
Criteo, a performance marketing technology company, reports in its Q4 2014 State of Mobile Commerce Report that mobile transactions now represent more than 30% of global e-commerce transactions. Source: Criteo. Jonathan Wolf, Chief Product Officer at Criteo, stated that a lack of information about mobile commerce has led many marketers to underestimate the potential of this market. Criteo’s State of Mobile Commerce Report leverages their extensive transaction-level data, encompassing billions of transactions, to provide a clearer picture of the global mobile commerce landscape...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/criteo-predicts-that-half-of-all-e-commerce-in-asia-will-be-conducted-through-mobile-devices/

item.title: The commercial property forecast for Q4 2014 is at its lowest in Hong Kong
item.description:
Singapore Marina Bay business district at night. The Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS) Global Commercial Property Monitor for the fourth quarter of 2014 suggests that while economic indicators show a decline in the Hong Kong economy, growth is expected to rise steadily this year. In Hong Kong, the RICS Occupier Sentiment Index (OSI) decreased slightly from +4 to -3 during the last quarter. The RICS Investment Sentiment Index (ISI) remained negative at -3...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-commercial-property-forecast-for-q4-2014-is-at-its-lowest-in-hong-kong/
